intro: Pseudoruellia perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's pseudoruellia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with slightly hairy surfaces, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found growing in rocky or forested areas, showcasing its adaptability to diverse soil types. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
